reviews.text: Awesome palace next to water. Decent audio tour is available in multi-laguages. There is also a coffee shop for a quick bite.
Amazing palace which is used by Sultan Abdulaziz around 1880. Sultan II Abdulhamid Han lived his last years in this palace. The interior and furniture are beautiful. It's worth paying a visit.
Striking in its opulence. Great historical site of the waning days of the Ottoman Empire.

One of the most magnificent places to see in Istanbul. It has a completely stunning architecture resembling the true life of Abdul Azeez. The garden is a lovely place to take some photos and enjoy the views of Bosphorus. 

At the moment the palace is under construction but that is only for one of the four corners of the main building. 

I highly recommend this place to anyone that visits Istanbul.

I got lost in this place but I love the view at sun set I took this picture but I could not recall the name or which part b/c of the rush it is in the Asian part not far from phosphor  brig. People there was so helpful and show me the road and made my day good at the end it was my last day and I do not want to lost my train.

Highest point in Çamlıca. Beautiful view over Istanbul. There is a cafe where you can eat, drink and enjoy the beautiful view over Istanbul. 
Only sad thing is that not only the tourist also the Turkish people leave a lot of waste on the floor. Otherwise it's an awesome place to visit
It's really one of the most wonderful places in Istanbul.  it's in Anatolian side. In clear weather you can see most of the city from up there. The hill overlooks amazingly the Bosphorus Bridge.

It's very good place for a quick break. This placed has lots of room to improve the beautification, like the buses outside the HILL kills the scenes experience, can be improved with nice sloppy gardening or art.

A recommended place to visit! This hill is located in the Asian part of Turkey and from here you can see the European part. It gets quite foggy sometimes but once the fog is clear, the view is mesmerising. There is also lots of local stall and a restaurant. Make sure to bring a jacket because it is a bit windy here.

The highest point of Asian Istanbul, a good spot to have a Greek coffee, a glass of water and some loukomi.  Did I forget to mention the glorious vista, yet another have to see when in Istanbul treats.
Sicak bir ortam,guven ve kalite ayni yerde

Exceptional food and service. Although it was busy, it was quiet enough to enjoy conversation. Enjoyable to watch the staff and owner, meticulous attention to detail and a genuine enjoyment in their work. Will be back. Thank you for a wonderful meal!

Had dinner here with my mom on a busy Saturday night. Lots of tasty tapas. Service was friendly. Food was good. Will return to try more dishes. We hosted a large corporate event at Moda. I was so happy with the support Moda supplied. The event was smooth easy and Juliette, Francois and the staff were just incredible. Thank you so much for contributing so much to such a successful evening.
Thank you for an outstanding wedding reception. The best food ever at a wedding, attentive staff and such a wonderful venue. Peter and Sue Freeman
Love the new location. Food is great service was excellent. The menu is ideal for sharing tapas plates through to main meals. Can’t wait to go back and try things that we didn’t choose this time.
Nice food . Funny mix of staff. Mainly not Spanish. In any case worth visiting for tasting something different and getting great attention from the personnel.

If you are old enough you may recognize some of these toys from your childhood. To me, it was more about browsing intricate private collection than nostalgia. I still found couple toys from my childhood. This collection includes toys from all over the world. It has a nice cafe where you can take a break. Prepare to climb some stairs as it does not have an elevator (not wheelchair acessible), but this old historic building adds to the theme.
Good place to go especially for adults. They can recognize the politics of the last 100 years in toys.
A fascinating place to enjoy, a place full of details designed by passion whit unique smell for each room.

This toy museum is amazing. I saw toys from the 1850s to the 1960s across multiple different continents; handmade and factory produced.
Particular highlights:
- the hallway to the toilets looks like a submarine.
- a picture of the creator, Sunay Akin, as a young boy with a tin boat that a photographer gave him as a prop, but which the young boy thought was given to him as a souvenir! I can just imagine the conversation with a young boy to convince him to give the toy back!
- such well preserved toys from WWII, with a heartbreaking background.
Things to be aware of: 
- the museum is very crowded, tonnes of kids will be there
- the place is four or five stories but each level by itself is relatively small: you will spend a long time on each floor though because each display is packed full of little toys that will catch your eye.
- this place is NOT wheelchair friendly; there are no lifts and the stairs between each level are tiny, steep and winding without proper handrails.

Such an incredible place to see. Great toy collection from all around the world. Also it’s a nice coincidence with Mr. Akin, the founder of the Istanbul toy museum. He behaves so kind and friendly. You should read his books which contain great stories of the toys and people.

Nice ruins of a castle. There are some beautiful views at the very top. Not a difficult walk at all. Before or after the walk you can have a coffee or a bite to eat just below where you also have a nice view of the water and surrounding areas.

Provides a nice view point during the few hours there while doing the full tour on the Bosphore. 
Originally the access was closed by a metallic door but eventually around 1pm some guard came over and opened the door for us. 
The castle itself isn't that interesting as nothing was made for visitors.

Toros castle in s a very nice place to visit. Located almost at the end of Bosphorus with a spectacular view to the third bridge or the city. You will reach the port of Anadolu Kavağı, easily and then you can walk up to the hill. İt takes some time so make sure it's not a very hot day. Also it is accessible by car. You can find some places to enjoy a coffee a few meters away.

We have found the castle by a chance - we saw it from the ferry when arriving to the Anadolu Kavaği. It took us about 20 min to walk there from the ferry terminal. You have to pass the Yoros restaurant on the slope.
Fantastic location is the main asset of the castle. The castle offers commanding views of the Bosphorus Strait, third bridge and Black Sea. You can watch not just ships enetering and departing Bosphorus strait, but also enjoy lush hilly country - so different from the Istanbuls crowds.
The castle is not well-kept and acess to the courtyard is prohibited. Pity.
Historical Castle, though in bad shape now. But still feels good to be there. Beautiful scenery overlooking the Black Sea across the 3rd Bridge.
Good
Tarihi cadde ...güzel mekan
Good
Tarihi cadde ...güzel mekan
Good
Tarihi cadde ...güzel mekan

I accept that there might be single negative experiences but do not understand the general comment. The restaurant is ok, but the sitting area outside is nice and comfortable. Prices are average and not too high. Mezze and main dishes are delicious. The personal is polite and always helpful. Of course, like in all restaurants in Kadiköy, you can find a dirty sheet or plate on the table or the staff does not wait for your wish close to the table. But this is typical for crowded Kadiköy during rush hour. That's why we love Kadiköy / it s very lively. We came to a table which was used just a minute ago and asked for a new sheet - we got it immediately. There was a fork with rests - we got a new one.
This happens, just ask.

Kalitesiz bir yer, garsonlar çok ilgisiz ve kaba. Yemekler hakkında bir eleştiri yaptığınızda hoşlanmayacağınız tepkiler alabilirsiniz. Sinirli ve agresifseniz kesinlikle gitmeyin ben kendimi zor tuttum. Hele de yanınızda kız arkadaşınız varsa hiç gitmeyin.
sef garson 8 tabak yemek yemedigimiz icin bizi sevmedi. keyifsiz bi yer
Bir garson çok kaba .Kesinlikle gidilecek yer değil.Kimseye de tavsiye etmem.Bir kişinin bile kaba olması o kuruluşu çok kötü etkiler.

Öyle çok param yok ilgi düşkünüde değilim. Müzik çok önemli değil bir şeyler tıngırdasın ben kafamı çeker makul bi fiyat öder çeker giderim diyorsanız orası burası işte. Temiz. Garsonlar Ehh işte. Müzik var ama hiç iyi değil. Konum öok yukqrıda biraz efor sarfetmeniz lazım. Manzara yok. İçeride sizi cezbedecek bir güzellikte yok ama fiyatları makul. Gir içeri kafayı çek azbi para öde çık. Hepsi bu. İyi eylenceler

Loved the food, loads of variety, good ambience, great service. The chef manning the counter explained all the food in the buffet for the day and made sure we chose a little bit of all the things we might like. The food is weighed and you are charged accordingly. We had some amazing food like meat cooked in Buttermilk, with quince fruit, some dolmas. Loved every bite! Wish I can visit again.

Nice place to have lunch.
This place came highly recommended and it passed. It is good but nothing out of the ordinary in my opinion. Maybe I had too much hype built up.
The food was good, service was nice and prices were constrained (£15 for 2 with 2 starters and 2 mains including tip).
If you want to play it safe, come here but I would have preferred to try something different.

Having seen this restaurant on Chef's Table, I was pleasantly surprised how down-to-earth the whole experience was. Friendly and quick service, a wide variety of traditional regional dishes to choose from - options i had were both delicious and interesting. I was delighted to see a whole charred pumpkin arrive from the sister restaurant while I was there! The area is also great - vibrant fruit, olive, and fish vendors and easy walking distance from the Kadikoy ferry.

Even though this place is famous,  there are many places you can eat much more tastier spending less money. I accept that tastes of appetizers are good. Except appetizers there are many places that are superior to it. It is much more expensive than necessary.
Very good restaurant. You get to taste real Turkish food apart from the typical kebabs and grilled meats. Great value for the price you pay. Totally recommended!
The food is one of the best in Istanbul.  The view is really relaxing though it doesn't quite overlooks the bosphorus.
Excellent food and ambiance
Delicious food excellent service, the best choice.
You can find Turkish traditional Adana kebap and variations
Excellent service and food. highly recommended. 👍👍👍

Magnificent park with a beautiful view of the coast. The old mansions on the grounds are set up a restaurants perfect for breakfasts. Beautiful playgrounds and gardens as well. This is the best place to take in the istanbul tulip festival help every April.
We were here for the Tulip Flower Festival.... Beautiful creations, but many arrangements we're not fully-bloomed yet. Their restaurant has a nice view from the top overlooking the lake...
Very nice place to share in family but it is too crowded. Of course it is because of the tulips festival until end of April. This is a very enjoyable park.
Beautiful park with plenty of playground options for all ages of kids! A couple historic old homes that have been converted into beautiful restaurants.

The perfect choice in April especially in week days in order to have more relaxed 😌. You can find a cafeteria or restaurants or bring your own food 🥘 but not a place for barbecue of course. In this time of year you can see the heavens on earth on that place

A very nice place to visit while in Turkey.
Specially at night.
You will enjoy the view of the bridge lights and 5he water beneath you.
You can't get out of there without trying compar potatoes.
There are many caravans selling this food with a great variety.
Transportation to the place is easy to get and always available, but you will walk for a bit to teach the place.
The mosque looked amazing from outside, but unfortunately it was late for me to visit get inside and take a closer look.
Excellent experience! Lovely sea views. You can take a cruise to explore the asian coast and European coast. You can feed the birds. It was a great time! Definitely a place to visit in Istanbul
This is one of best place in Istanbul. You can see the Asia from Europe with the beautiful bridge and bosporus views. There are many attractions are available around the mosque.
Amazing details on the mosque with baroque influences. The interior of the mosque is even more astonishing. It's different from other mosques, it has a lot of glass windows and has sunlight in it.
Stunning mosque with shopping area around. You can see the big bridge crossing the Bosphorus river.  Absolutely should visit!

Gorgeous museum with an beautiful and extensive curated collection. On one side, they have artifacts dating back to the earliest civilizations, getting closer and closer to the modern era and you go up the stairs. The other side of the museum is full of rich and beautiful ottoman pottery, clothing, furniture, and items of daily life. My husband and I had a wonderful time and it was definitely one of the best museums I've ever been to. Set aside 2 hours: there is so much to see here and it's all worth it!
It's a very well designed private museum with  special collections

This is a gem of a museum that may not be on every TO DO list, but we'll worth the trip to Sariyer's lovely Bosphorus shoreline. The home contains wonderful well-marked displays of Iznik pottery, Ottoman women's attire,  antiques, textiles, and even a few pieces of armor.  It is cozy, uncrowded access point to amazing Ottoman and Istanbul history. A must see!!!
Small yet complete collection. Park your car opposite to Sariyer iskelesi then reach to the museum after a nice walk along the Bosphorus in about 10 min.
Nice to see
Its nice place
Huge and nice restaurant, with nice barbecue, horse riding, and volleyball options

very bad foods . dirty area . so expensive for the services. 
never go there
The food is too expensive and the quality is bad , services bad and the experience is bad , it's not recommend for any one .
Very bad and expensive

Very nice restaurant in an amazing location.  Food is good, only fish, price is fair (I'd say cheap), and the surroundings are worth seeing.  I recommend a relaxing walk to the cliffs, and enjoy the see.  Outside the restaurant there is plenty of room for the children to play, either on the beach or in the grass.

A very nice atmosphere and good food...
If you go during the day there is a wonderful view as well but to dark to be enjoyed at night.
Service was very good.
The only drawback is the prices.... it was too expensive !
They also serve alcohol.
Will not recommend.  It is just OK but not worth travelling there when there is many better seafood restaurant is other nicer areas of Istanbul.
Excellent seafood and beautiful location

If you have not been there yet, go, just go..mezes are fresh, fish is fresh and many choices, and you are at the blacksea front. Phenomenal 

Dont expect much luxury though. Very good but down to earth, comfortable, causal.

Great location. Beautiful, updated rooms with spacious bathrooms. The staff is warm and courteous. Food is delicious. My room had a great view of the city and Bosphorus. Would stay there again in a heartbeat.

It's a worthy 5 star hotel in Istanbul. Its price rate is affordable. . Its room is clean and tidy. The check-in staff is quick and friendly. Breakfast is variable and quite good. and The location is convenient to acccess many place inside the city

Excellent clean hotel with an amazing view of the City, really friendly staff. Good sized rooms with all the facitilities you could ask for.

Couple of gripes you can move freely between floors only the level your room is assigned too so we couldn't visit other family members on another floor. Secondly booking via the Turkish Airlines app never received my bonus Miles&Smiles points I emailed the hotel with no reply.

I would probably try another hotel Next time.

If there were ten stars to award, this charming hotel with great elegance would get them all. It is very well located near Taksim square. Some rooms have Bosporus view. The staff is amazing. Each one makes you feel as if you are the only guest in the hotel. The rooms are elegantly furnished  in a  classical style with an Ottoman ambiance. Each room , aside from a comfortable bed, has a leather love seat and a desk. All marble bathroom and the walk in shower are big. Hotel’s three restaurants compete with each other in the sense of the delicious menu they offer. They offer the best examples of the Turkish cuisine in the most delicious way. There is also a Japanese restaurant which is absolutely great. The bar is elegant and romantic with well chosen background music. The hotel houses the company’s nationwide famous patisserie and offers to die for cakes, cookies , chocolates and their own production best of the best Turkish delight. The indoor swimming pool is beautifully designed. There is a Turkish hammam-bath that can be privately booked. The gym is fully equipment and spacious. The hairdressers , two separate shops for men and women, attract local Istanbul clientele as well as hotel guests. It is a pure joy to stay at this hotel and leave yourselves in the hands of a very capable staff who does their job with great care and smile. If l had a choice to stay at some well known hotel chain on the Bosporus and pay four times more and fight Istanbul’s horrendous traffic on the Bosporus  or Divan, my choice would always be for Divan as a person who also stayed at the other ones. Thank you to all Divan staff and its managers.

Thanks for everything.... the staff was so polite and helpful, only 1 things I was angry because I request to have late checking out they tell me after 12 PM they will charge 10 € for per 1hour.  So please change this role. Best Regards,

I went to the Dervish ceremony. I would only recommend it if you are really, really interested (and happy to donate your money for the cause). The price it is 100 Turkish Lira. 
The refused to make reservation, when I arrived 15 min before, told me it was full already, they asked me to wait just in case of a free spot, after a few minutes they sold me a ticket (also to the other 10 people behind me, so, yes, it was space, they just wanted us to wait in the rain).
They have swirling dervishes show every Sunday at 5pm. Definitely worth to see. Plan it accordingly since the tickets sell fast.
Was really interesting, went twice. Once to see the museum and then on the Sunday to see the actual ceremony. Would have liked to hear some of the Jerrahi zikr and chanting as well.

This amazing place is so nice and kept the building buitifull, this building is located in the center of beyoglu with beautiful garden en beautiful museum. It’s worth going and reading around. On Sundays there is a live show of derwishs.
If you are interested in Sufism then this place deserve your visiting. The enterence fee is 20 ₺.
İt is a beautiful museum. Here you can see , the famous painting "Tortoise trainer" by Osman Hamdi Bey and his other works. Besides that on the other floor the exhibitions are changing all the time.

This museum offers a wide variety of pieces on display from fine to contemporary arts.  Well worth 2 hours of your day to explore the four different levels.  They also have a nice display showing ancient measurement tools from the Anatolia region.

A tastefully curated museum that does a superb job of mixing traditional Turkish art with more modern artists. I was particularly impressed with the visiting exhibitions that featured innovative, modern artists. Definitely with the visit when you are in Istanbul.

Took me about an hour to see the whole place. it has different levels. friendly staff. Different art pieces to see depending on the exhibition they have going on. i liked historic figures one. They also had clean toilets.

Pera Museum (Turkish: Pera Müzesi) is an art museum in the Tepebaşı quarter of the Beyoğlu (Pera) district in Istanbul, Turkey, located at Meşrutiyet Avenue No. 65 (adjacent to İstiklal Avenue and in close proximity to Taksim Square.) It has a particular focus on Orientalism in 19th-century art.
The Pera Museum was founded by the Suna and İnan Kıraç Foundation in 2005.
The museum is located in the historic building of the former Bristol Hotel, which was designed by architect Achille Manoussos and built in 1893.
Stunning Church next to Taksim Square
We stayed on Innpera hotel just infront of the church but it was closed all days
Pace and beauty! You must go and see this beautiful orthodox church, from the heart of Istanbul!
very solemN church . .the aRchitectUral of these church is really goOd.froM taksim meydan its just at firSt leFt bACK OF burger King
Wonderfull

There's always something interesting to see at the Istanbul Modern, but the new (or perhaps temporarily new) location doesn't do it justice. The multilevel arrangement detracts from the grand view on the collection, which in my opinion was one of the stunning aspects of the bosphoros-side location. And of course the outside view is gone. Still, an interesting collection and venue for temporary exhibitions.
The museum is fairly small considering its price but there is some very cool stuff here. Quality over quantity. I would definitely recommend it if you like modern art.

It’s a small but fun collection of modern work by mostly Turkish artists. There’s a changing exhibit on the 1st floor and a really impressive permanent collection that focuses on abstract artists and a good sampling of fabrics. I saw the entire museum in about an hour.

From the US and wasn’t sure what to expect. Don’t waste your time or your $17. 4 floors of wasted space. Very few art pieces and uneventful gift shop. Best part was the coffee at the entrance. Strangely the best cup of coffee in Istanbul.

Personally I am not that impressed with the continuous exhibition of the museum
However they do have amazing special exhibitions at times. So my recommendation is to check out what these are, if it’s something you want to see, it’s well worth the quite steep entry fee.
Ohhh i can not really describe the feeling. The book must be read then the museum. Amazing experience!

Amazing cute museum.
If you haven't read the book better have the audio guide

Very attractive and memorable ...
It's better to read “the museum of innocence” of Orhan Pamuk before visiting the Museum...
Instead of buying the museum ticket, you can buy the book...

This museum is a really unique experience.. Having read the book years before, while my friend and I were wandering in the museum, from chapter to chapter, everything was revealed, the story was coming to the surface again and tears came up to remind us how touching the narration of Kemal was, how deep and sick but genuine his love of Fusun was. This original story-telling museum is not only the museum of a book of Orhan Pamuk, but also a journey back to the past of Istanbul, a melancholic delineation of a certain time, a true jump to the years of innocence. I will absolutely visit the museum again. Very moving and touching and unique

A museum dedicated to only one book of Orkhan Pamuk, but what a museum! It gives you the slice of time and lifestyle of Istanbul. 
As you climb up the floors, you move from chapter to chapter. Reading the book before visiting will be a great bonus.
Buy your tickets from the ticket window by the entrance door, enjoy the museum and once you finished you can enjoy little book store at the basement.
The food is great, except the döner is small, but this quality/price in Taksim is great !

Very good price indeed and right in the city centre. Good food and not touristic (supposedly not many people heard of it as it is not right on the Main Street). About 10 TRY for a kebab, a drink and a dessert of your selection. You can’t expect fine dining food here because you pay so little money.
Visited here twice, you can find delicious local food
it’s not fresh & enough food , bad decoration, not tasty,
Service is okay and prices too but if you order durum don't expect a lot of meat there. In 100gr durum we had max 20gr of meat 🤷🏻‍♀️

This was the kokoreç that showed me the beauties of kokoreç! Before eating Galata's kokoreç, I thought it was okay food but not something I liked. But one bite of the flavorful, finely diced intestines on the fluffy toasted bun changed everything for me. I now count kokoreç among myself most favorite of Turkish foods and look for opportunities to return! Try it!!!
Yummy! Fair prices also
Ben kokoreç sevmezdim normalde beni arkadaşım götürdü zorla bir  bir çeyrek yedim bir daha istedim artık herzaman galata kokoreçten yiyorum grand haliç hotele de sipariş veriyorum 15 dakikada geliyo
Kokoreçleri güzel, sıcak kanlı bir işletme. Arkadaşlarımla birlikte güzelce doyduk üstüne midye ikramlarınıda yedik. Hızlıca ye kalk bir yer. :)
Gayet basarili
Harika
Eh beğendik

Hayatımda yediğim en güzel çöp şiş buydu sanırım. Böyle bir lezzet yok. Ezmeleri de çok güzel, önünüzde hazırlıyorlar, daha önceden yapılmış ezme koymuyorlar. 
Çalışanların ilgisi de çok güzeldi, kendilerine tekrar çok teşekkür ediyorum, en kısa sürede tekrar gideceğim.

Servis rezil , terasa bir kisi bakiyor yetisemiyor , mezeler buyuk fakat soguk donmus fasil var diyorlar calan roman abiler kendinden bezmis cd den calan muzikleride kapadilar bir kere gittim hata yaptim aman siz yapmayin.
Mezeler müthiş ve Metin Bey'in gösterdiği ihtimam da
Супер аутентичное место.

Absolutely one of the best restaurants we have visited together over the past few years!  Incredibly designed place tucked away up a staircase up an elevator and up another staircase.  Once you’re to the top you’re surrounded by absolute beauty, a friendly staff, and world class food.  Can’t say enough good things about the mushroom/potato appetizer, the grilled sea bass, and the loin/meatball entree...can’t wait to go back

Great place with a nice view, especially if you’re seated at the barside. Most of the staff speaks excellent English. 

We had quite some difficulties to reach the place by taxi but when we called the guy of the restaurant gave us an excellent description how to reach the place. We were almost an hour late and it was no problem...

When we arrived the service was really good and we also enjoyed the food. It was pretty busy inside, but still we got our food in a short time and it was really tasty.

Would definitely recommend this place!!
Very nice restaurant with a mixed profile of fish and meat. Wonderful view and very friendly and professional personnel. I will definitely go back.

Great place for drinks and food however the desert wasn't great. Great scenery,  you would never expect it's a renowned restaurant from the apartment entrance you first come across. It's set in an historical building, you take a lift to the top floor. Not appropriate for the disabled as you still climb another flight of stairs to get to the roof floor. But well worth it when you see the wow scenery.

When my boyfriend brought me to this place I didn't know what to expect. In the narrow dark street only a small sign gave notice that a restaurant was hiding somewhere. Stepping out of the elevator though an amazing view met us. A stylish place with very friend staff and great tasting food. We had drinks with our food and they are recommendable!

Food is decent and the waitress explained well. Portions are medium. Just a caution, we ordered our food and the waitress brought some bread which we assumed was complimentary but in the end were charged for it. I questioned it and it was removed. Always check your bill!!

Extra charge for bread and butter, not listed on the menu. Ordered a mushroom and zucchini quiche. It had no crust, was overly gooey with bechemel sauce and came with a hair on my plate.  Service was lacking despite not being busy. Had to go up to the counter to order and pay. Maybe it's hard for them to pay attention to solo diners!
Wow is this good vegetarian food.  Everything was perfectly balanced and interesting.  Not overpriced either.  Atmosphere is comfortable and classy without being too fancy.  Really romantic spot.
Really nice location, heaven for vegetarians. Stuff friendly, nice sized portions, stuff speaks English. You need to go there. And ask for there homemade spicy souce

Very beautiful atmosphere.
The use of spaces is interesting.
Food is so well prepared and balanced in taste and presentation. 
Staff are friendly. 
Vegan options are available.

Didn’t try the food... but we went there for drinks... all of the 5 stars are for the breathtaking view and the ambiance.. we went on a weekday and it was half full.. the service was attentive and professional.

We loved it !!! Went here for valentine's day. The food, ambience, view and drinks were outstanding. Also our Hostess were really lovely. Definitely recommend this place. Go there to watch the sunset, it's such an amazing view and they have really good cocktails.
Amazing view but try to go on a sunny day so you can see the full Istanbul. Food is good, not too turistic. Service is fine.

Stunning view from the rooftop: 360 degrees of pure Istanbul beauty
We loved the service there! The staff is very professional and very responsive. We came for dinner, we ordered some cold and hot appetizers such as avocado hummus, smoked eggplant dip, tempura shrimps, Arugula salad, For main dishes we had cherry duck and T bone steak. 
We loved the food and the atmosphere and the music. We will come back for sure.
Be aware for large groups! They invoice u more then u consume. Ask for individually or pair invoice. Count what u drink. Better avoid if u do not like to be robbed.

Great breakfast! Should not be missed.
The location is of by a block. Keep walking down the street away from pera and you'll find it on your left side.
Great for lunch! Fresh, delicious food!
Amazing cakes and little treats!
It is really spacious and airy. You can find different kind of events during the whole week. The only common point of these events are that they are all high quality events that you can enjoy a lot.
Love the venue and the events they organise, not too  enamoured with their drinks prices. We paid about 50 liras for a bottle of Bomonti and a non-alcoholic ginger ale!
Nice place ! Not very willing stuff / very rude the guys who kept our coats !!! Especially towards tourists

Went for the golden oldies new year's party..it was lovely. Highly recommended..just wish they played more popular dance songs... especially around the count down ...some of the songs are popular..but not very exciting to dance to. Still..a good night! Happy 2018! 😃
Perfect place to enjoy a night with friends... You can choose having a dinner in any of its restaurants, a quick snack with local beer and a good alternative concert in Babylon...all in One

Large palace with several pavilions beautifully decorated with tiles. Great view of modern Istanbul from the rear of the gardens.  It can be seen in a couple hours, but is also a great way to spend a leisurely  day. If you buy the Museum Card beware that you can only enter the palace once, so visit the Harem while you are there. I missed it when I tried to see it the next day

Amazing palace! You can enjoy a great atmosphere for hours. Enter to this place cost 60 lira. This museum include so many interesting area's like armoury chamber, kitchen, library. Near the main entrance stay maket of the palace in miniature. You should see it!

Wow this place is amazing. I would definitely recommend visiting this place. It is amazing how they have so many sacred things in one place. Here is the place where you will be able to see belongings of the Prophet Muhammad (S.A.W) and the Sahabas. Since this was considered the  headquarters of the Ottoman sultans there is a lot of amazing architecture.

It's nice museum but too long line for getting the entrance tickets. Ancient swords, war ornaments, historical and cultural items are displayed. Photography  is prohibited.  Kids under 12 are free but you must provide Passport copy at ticketing counter to get FREE Ticket for kids. Small gift shop is also there close to exit area.

Topkapı Palace speaks about the bygone eras of Constantinople or today’s Istanbul. The scenic views are awesome. The tulips in the front palace ground is astonishingly pretty and adds to the charm of the new palace. The palace has got some intricate work of art. The museum is a must visit where history comes alive.

It's a must! The Sultan Ahmet Mosque, which is known as the Blue Mosque as well, is easily accessible by a short walk from the most touristic center in Istanbul. You cannot miss it as it can been seen from far away. Visitors are welcomed to walk around during daily opening hours. Interior visits are allowed in between religious services. An excellent location for memorable photos and one of the most impressive Turkish monuments.

Come with no prayer is ongoing so you can get inside.. Try to read about the history of the place. No need to hire a guide to waste your money... There are enough websites to read about this without wasting your money in any guide...this is my way of traveling but if you like one they are easy to find... Still you Must come here

The Sultan Ahmet Mosque, which is popularly known as the Blue Mosque as well, is easily accessible by a short walk from the most touristic center in Istanbul. Really hard to miss as it can been seen from a far distance. Visitors are welcomed to walk around during daily opening hours. Interior visits are allowed in between religious services. An excellent location for memorable photos and one of the most impressive Turkish monuments. I would encourage visitors to hire a local guide for a short tour around the area and combine the visit to at least two or three locations. There are magnificent places to visit nearby and the price while small will add lots of value to the experience. A must see.

The Blue Mosque is one of the most beautiful mosques in the world. Its real name is the Sultan Ahmed Mosque, but people know it as the Blue Mosque because of the handmade ceramic tiles that line the walls.

—>Fun fact: the lamps have hangers to put the ostrich eggs that were used during that period to ward off the spiders—which are protected in Islam because a story tells that they saved the life of the Prophet Muhammad.

Lovely  mosque completed around 1616. A must see place in İSTANBUL . You will see flocks of visitors. Local Guides are available. Please note there is repair work going on. Please check visiting days and times. There is clothing guide lines and need to remove shoes before your enter main praying hall of mosque.

Big bus tours are available, don't have to purchase a ticket online, you can buy it on the spot. Come early so can enjoy both Red and Blue bus tour on same ticket.The earphone is provided in the bus and can select any language  from a list of languages, English is included. Pick the the upper deck in summer for better view.
Turkey is a fantastic place. Very safe, and easy to get around. A wonderful transport system that allows u to c Turkey at your leisure and at a reasonable price. Hoping to go back soon.
Very worm and friendly place. You move around 24 hours Without any fear. Great food and shopping places. Don't forget to bargain

Beautiful square at the old town, with many historical monuments as well as popular touristic attractions and museums at the area around. Crowdy place at the morning hours, more peaceful and quiet with nice lighting during the evening.
It's a nice place to visit. Nothing much to do but walking around. It has the real feel of Istanbul

Istanbul Archaeology museum has one of the grandest collection of archaeological findings. Unfortunately a large part was closed under renovation when I visited and rest I couldn't cover as they closed the museum at 6:30 instead of 7:00. 

Even then,  they have an unbelieveable collection of historical finds from the bronze age, and from years before the birth of Jesus Christ. 

I was in disbelieve as I looked at how they managed to find, preserve and display items that were literally centuries old. 

Unbelievable experience. Must visit, but take few hours and come here to actually enjoy the place.

Most of the collection is currently under renovation. Probably only takes an hour to see the available collection. Highly recommend the ancient section. Skip the scarcophogai. The blue tiled building is beautiful. Dedicate some time to just sit and appreciate the building itself (the ceramic collection it houses isn't very special).

The archaeological museum is under intense renovations and only a small section is open to the public.  But even then, the part of the building that was open was dark and cold and people could touch these ancient works and security didn't care.  The museum of the ancient orient is very nice.

A great range of excellent artefacts.    I went with low expectations but was completely 'wowed' by the visit.  I would definitely recommend it.  We bought the 5 day Istanbul Museum Pass and this is just one of the many sites we visited on the card.

It is sad that one of the world's finest collections of archaeology can't properly deal with what to do with the collection while the building is being renovated. What's on display is of course fantastic, but so much is not on display. What is on display is not a selection of the most important pieces of the museum, but the parts that are not being currently rennovated. Also, it's really about time to refresh the signage and the informational part of the museum.
A must visit museum to understand the geography and politics of different dynasties. From Rashidun to Ottoman. From Mongolia to Egypt. Finally, a fine art work of Ottomans are shown.

Interesting, but missable. More history than art. Each exhibit feels more like it's a collection of artifacts representing a specific civilization, than sitting the beauty of the pieces in their own right.

A truly remarkable museum showcasing the history of Islam and its path through Turkey. Wonderful artifacts which has been maintained in pristine condition. A beautiful and eloquent way to share the history of Turkey and Islam. Well worth a visit for history and religious buffs

The Turkish and Islamic Arts Museum (Turkish: Türk ve İslam Eserleri Müzesi) is a museum located in Sultanahmet Square in Fatih district of Istanbul, Turkey. Constructed in 1524, the building was formerly the palace of Pargalı Ibrahim Pasha, who was the second grand vizier to Suleiman the Magnificent, and was once thought to have been the husband of the Sultan's sister, Hatice Sultan.

The collection includes notable examples of Islamic calligraphy, tiles, and rugs as well as ethnographic displays on various cultures in Turkey, particularly nomad groups. These displays recreate rooms or dwellings from different time periods and regions.
Tbf, it was pretty sick. Even our son, Tom, had a nice time. Didn't have a tantrum once. Scenes.

Everything was lovely there.. the scent of beautiful flowers. the view..you can relax on a bank and look up at seagulls nests in the trees ..kids can safely play ..you can visit the Islamic technological museum there where you discover  the greatness of Islam back in history and how they contributed in the scientific discoveries.. philosophy.. physics ..chemistry.. alchemy.. medicine of the Renaissance era and the material they used for their discoveries and studies

Nice park to go and get some fresh air plus getting to know more about amazing Istanbul. Lots of seats are available, breathtaking view especially in spring and summer.. Variety of flowers all around the park also you can buy corn, nuts and the traditional Turkish simit on the gate to get more nice walk.

Beautiful park. When we pass from there everything was under construction for the spring and that is so awesome because it seems they care a lot. New flowers are planted the old grass replaced. Very beautiful

One of my favourite spots in Istanbul. A tranquil place with trees, lawns, fountains and the most spectacular display of flowers, mainly tulips at the end of March and in April. We loved watching the many bulbs and the roll-on lawns being planted and layed out.

Well laid out park. No admission charge. Located pretty close to Topaki Palace and the Architecture museum which can be pretty busy. So a good place for a wander to escape the crowds for a while. Plenty park benches and a wee cafe to pop into.

To be honest, I would not really call it a museum. All the exhibits are copies, and yet it's equally not a typical science museum where you get to try out the items or carry out mini experiments. Additionally, even though it's interesting to learn about science in the Muslim countries, the tone of the narration was very anti-West and aggressive. It's as if they use a certain level of propaganda there. I prefer to separate museums from national agendas :)
Wonderful museum. Very interesting exhibits and very informative. Note that there's no ancient artifacts, just modern reconstructions to demonstrate historical items.

I was really interested to see this place as I know that in the middle ages when Europe was divided and almost illiterate backwater after collapse of Roman Empire new Muslim civilization was leading in many fields. And museum will try to show all of that. But I would like museum to be more modern and what is lacking is explanation what happened and why all that simply vanished as it never happened and this museum has to remind us what was lost somewhere somehow when religious leaders decided that science and rest is not important at all. That was proved to be doom for them from which they are still not recovered. Similar was with China when it closed itself but they are now again superpower.

A must go.
Amazing experience.
No issues or troubles.
Best to buy an all inclusive multi access museum card. Works out way cheaper.

Its an ok ok place. There are many exhibits but most of them are replicas. Has different sections like physics, chemistry, ophthalmology etc. You can visit this place if you have got the Museum Pass, else its ok to skip this place. Separate single entry (without museum pass) is around 12 or 15 Turkish Liras. This museum. Is located in Gulhäne Park itself,right beside the Archeology museum.

A great example of Ottoman architecture where there are a lot of domes and minarets shaped like pencils.
It is open for both prayers and visitors but women have to cover their bodies and hair. The mosque offers a free dress for women.
There is a small parks outside the mosque with benches and a fountain where you can rest and have a wonderful time and view of the mosque.

This is a great monument of victory for one of the greatest conqueror in history. He conquered the unbeatable Constantinople at 21 years of age which shows the great strategic ability and strong resolve of this young man. The mosque is an equally great example of genius engineering and it shows the magnificent contributions of this great man to culture and civilization.

Fatih cami, Sultan Fatih mehmet dönemi mükemmel eserlerinden. İstanbul a gelenlerin ilk görmesi gerekenlerden. Bölge çok canlı. Su kemerleri yanında. Ve Pek çok gurme restoran mevcut. Fatih Karadeniz Pide.ve Siirt Eşref Büryanı deneyin. 

It is a master piece mosque of Ottoman Empire. It is made in Fatih The Conquerer Era. Very beautifuly built in the style of domb mosque. Very quite, calm place for praying, or jyst to visit. You must visit and sit on the floor,take a deep breath, and meditate. There is a famous aqueduct nearby tgat you should visit. And there are many tastefull restaurants. For example Fatih Karadeniz Pide (Turkish Pizza in Black Sea region style of Turkey).and Siir Esref Buryan. Long cookes meat. 

Очень красивый мечет. Сделано прибизительно 600 лет назад,время Фатин Мехмет Султан. Обизателно видеть места. Акведук. И очень много ресторанов хорошие. Фатих карадениз пиде (турецкая пицца) и сиирт ешреф бюрян. Мясо долго готовлена.

It was a good place I could experience Turkish culture. I'd like to recommend here to foreigners who are not aware of Islam. Before you enter the Mosque, you have to follow some clothes guidelines. Basically, you need to cover your skin with something, especially women have to cover their hair, too. You can get fabrics but they don't look that clean, so if you don't want to use them, you should bring your own clothes or something to hide your hair! 

PS. Personally, I prefer this Mosque than European Cathedrals.

One of biggest mosque that i have ever seen. Its so nice and spiritual. The beauty of it is that they have recently made a single piece carpet for the entire mosque. In the mean time it has two floors where second floor is for women only. All in all definitely visit that place :)
Armenian nice and old plase
Görmek lazim

A old part of history as you walk about Istanbul.

Happened to be walking this way late into the evening and it looks amazing.
I believe it was constructed during the roman period of occupation.

This road is still used normally day to day. Cats go though it and pedestrians can walk on either side.

Feels amazing to see this archeology up front

Again, one of the main attractions in Istanbul. The aqueduct is one of the oldest installations in the city. What you can see now is only a piece of it, as a lot collapsed due to earthquakes. Still, it stands today as a proud testimony to what human engineering can achieve.

Odd how cars just drive through it. But also a modern VS. antique sort of set up. Very unique and appealing in a way, but odd. Overal if your around and like ancient stuff worth a sight. The sight itself is not very touristic however and might feel a little remote for tourists.

While it does have a busy road through the middle it's still worth the walk from the old town to see. It's amazing to see a 2,000 year old structure still standing. Whatever did the Romans do for us...

So amazing to see!  You really don’t want to miss this amazing construction that was done long before computers or even slide rules!  Walk along the aqueduct to walk back in time!  It’s truly an amazing sight in the heart of Istanbul!
A gem 💎 so tasty so cheap so friendly

Loved our stay here! The receptionist is friendly and helpful. Location is very near to blue mosque, hagia sophia, topkapi palace, basilica cistern, grand bazaar and spice bazaar. There’s BIM just 190 meter away. The breakfast was nice with great view overlooking the ocean.

The pictures from booking are not reflecting the reality. The bathroom and the room are very small. The kitchen is at last floor, not very organised.
Actualy, i think is in an old building, reconfigured to be a hotel.
Pro : The stuff was kind and very polite.
Great location, very close to main spots. Safe area. Room was comfortable and clean. Staff was very kind. I recommend this hotel!
Excellent service, staff  is provided personalize care about the guests.

A wonderful architectural mosque  started by an in-law and senior counsellor of Sultan Suleyman, Rustem Pasha, and which was only completed after his death by his wife and daughter of Sultan Suleyman, princess Mihrimah Suleyman. Its location in Eminonu overseeing a lot of the touristic sites around, is equally beautiful.
A significant beauty. Do not miss it between the narrow alleys of the area.
Small mosque but is worth seeing due to the interior being completed with blue tiles throughout. Great craftsmanship.
My opinion; Eminonu's best mosque !
Wonderful mosque.. awe inspiring art work in this place.. lighted by beautiful design one of peaceful and pleasant mosques at istanbul

This is a beautiful little mosque that is surrounded by  big buildings around it and you almost don't notice it. But I feel that it is one of the best mosques I have seen. From the moment you walk in you can feel this air of inner peace   and happiness.
Amazing
Great history and architecture
Good place
nice

We dine here for our last day in Istanbul and the experience was good. A very nice place with and an excellent service. A lot of dishes from which choose for, from traditional dish to American and European menu. Due to the fact that offer also a wide choice of alcohol beverage and some European meals is more popular between travelers, so the prices are quite hight for the offer (you can expect a bill near 100-150 each). Basically is a recommended place especially if it's your first day and you wanna start to taste something from turkey staying safe about ingredients or if you wanna enjoy some good place that serves alcohol beverage.

Good food. The restaurant is well located and has friendly service. The service was very fast as well. They have good selection of local and foreign beers with many big brands covered. The restaurant is attached with a small hotel. Recommend visit if you are in the area.
Great small restaurant and cafe.  Located in historic haighia sofia area. Friendly staff
We enjoyed the chicken and lamb casseroles here. Although expensive, the food and the mocktails (we had the 'refreshing cocktail') were great.

We found this place by just googling "best traditional Turkish food" and it definitely did not disappoint. The staff had a very descriptive understanding of the menu and the food itself was the most tasteful out of our 4 night stay in Istanbul. 
One of the best Turkish/Ottoman cuisines in Istanbul;
Friendly staff🤝
Fast service🏃‍♂️
Clean👍
Affordable
Delicious😋
Great music!😍
Would highly recommend to anyone visiting the faros Restaurant!!!
Special thanks to murat who helped everyone🙋‍♀️🙋‍♀️🙋‍♀️

I found this place by accident and ended up going back 3 times and taking other people.

The 1 star reviews down below are taking about a different restaurant I think.

If you can make it through the touts and the tourist restaurants to find this place you will be delighted by both the quality of the food and the prices.

I had the lentil soup (which was excellent, especially with a touch of chili added), and a kebab and salad, with a bottle of water and the bill came to 34TL (around €6). That was inclusive of the copious amount of bread.

The restaurant itself is not fancily decorated but the true heart of the place is the proprietor who will greet and thank you, and his team of staff who all feel like a warn family.

As others have said, check you have the right restaurant as this is one that is frequented by the locals and doesn't overcharge you.

The reviews below that talk about fish, and felaffel must be referring to a different restaurant as they aren't on the menu! This place has a simple two page menu only. I wish there was a way to transfer them to the correct place!

Wonderful people, good food and great prices served with grace. No hesitation to recommend them.

An amazing experience. As some people mentioned, there are other restaurants with the same name so make sure you save a photo of the front door so you do not go to the wrong one. The food was better in reality if you compare it with the pictures in the menu which is a first. The server wasn't sure about what to recommend since I do eat much meat and walked me to the open kitchen area to show me everything they offered. I ended up having a delicious liver with potatoes and vegetables. My wife had a tasty vegetables and kebat dish.

Don’t be misled by the glossy Karadeniz sign of the other place. This Karadeniz (pides and kebabs) is right across the electric shop and has a much more humble appearance. The menu is simple but delicious: scrumptious pides (that’s what we ordered) served by a staff who is delightfully nice. If you put some effort in your search you won’t miss it (and you’ll probably save some bucks). Two floors,white walls and a simple menu on the corner.

They receive you with smiles and happy faces, but as soon as you make a small order because you don't feel like eating a whole lamb, or just because you are not very hungry, their kindness goes away. Moreover, the food is below average.
I orded 2 pide but when the order come i was shoked very big one 😅 , otherwise very delicious very good for breakfast
Food was good, but can be better. The waiters are fun though... and there is a very relaxed atmosphere.

The worst food experienced at Istanbul! Ordered chicken sheesh kebab and lentil soup and Turkish Ravioli, all of them were served cold. Super blunt taste. All food items were over priced. Service was really poor. Their menu shows "fresh juice", but as we ordered pineapple juice, they served canned juice; although we asked which juices were available prior ordering and the waiter said, " all available". NOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL.

Not food related but certainly service related:
One waiter came to our table while we were trying to consume those awful foods, and suddenly kissed my baby (5months old!!). Unbelievable ill-mannered waiters; they don't have any sense of privacy!
Nice place to hang around
One of yhe best in Instabull...
Went here for diner during our citytrip. The food and drinks were amazing! There was also a really nice ambiance. Staff is also really friendly and helpful!

Awesome location! The place is very cozy and comfortable and the service is amazing. The staff is friendly. It’s perfect for a group of friends, for a family or even alone for a productive work session. The glass wall gives you great vibes.

It's a very decent hotel with amazing ambience with well priced food. It's a place where you can definitely try water pipes. That have plenty of flavors for it. Restaurant is very near to Blue Mosque.
Very good place to eat local dishes, drink and relax with shisha. Rest. Is located over interesting ancient basement- "catacombs"

Amazing place to smoke on a water pipe and people watch, just call ahead and reserve a window spot. 

Also when you are here make sure and look down. There is an ancient ruined Palace underneath and they have viewing from above in the restaurant. There are also two entrances out back where you can enter and explore the palace.

The food, service and atmosphere are excellent. We had a veggie pizza and a chicken dish and they were both delish!
Very relaxed and comfortable. Come and stay for a few hours, smoke hookah and order food when you get hungry. A brilliant place to visit with friends and spend time.

Simple love this place. It’s not only close to all the correct places but provides exceptional service. It is definitely expensive but money is all worth it. I didn’t like their food in the restaurant So I cannot recommend that. But you don’t have to eat there:)) 
Having platinum cafe next to the hotel is so nice. They have good young crowd and decent food as well. It’s a shisha place for all non smokers!

This hotel was amazing. The staff is impeccable, they learn your name and go well above and beyond to make your stay amazing. The hotel itself is situated within 5 minutes from the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, and the view from the roof is insane. The bartender here is phenomenal, they have a great list of cocktails but I suggest telling him what you like and letting him make a cocktail for you - seriously he made a "spicy" cocktail for me with passion fruit and pepper infused rum that was the best cocktail I've ever had in my life. The food here is great too, if you have a chance do the brunch or the wine and cheese tasting!

Four Seasons is a great hotel in a calm street close to the historic center.  The rooms are bordering a very nice garden.  The restaurant is an excellent place for lunch and dinner.  The bar with its very nice interior is a perfect spot for some relaxing time.
The staff were attentive and gracious. We had a wonderful evening in the restraint and bar, moving seemed from out doors to India as the evening cooled down. The food was lovely.

Beautiful hotel in the middle of the old city. The location could not be better. Its right next to the Blue Mosque and walking distance from the Grand Bazaar. 

The rooms are luxurious and immaculate. They are very well decorated and spacious. 

The food at the restaurant is excellent and offers a large variety of local dishes. 

The garden in the middle of the hotel is neatly kept and it feels like an oasis. 

An interesting fact about the building is that it used to be a prison back in the day. 

The staff is very courteous and knowledgeable.  And everyone speaks english. 

I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is the best place to stay in the Sultanahmet area.

It's a must! The Sultan Ahmet Mosque, which is known as the Blue Mosque as well, is easily accessible by a short walk from the most touristic center in Istanbul. You cannot miss it as it can been seen from far away. Visitors are welcomed to walk around during daily opening hours. Interior visits are allowed in between religious services. An excellent location for memorable photos and one of the most impressive Turkish monuments.

Come with no prayer is ongoing so you can get inside.. Try to read about the history of the place. No need to hire a guide to waste your money... There are enough websites to read about this without wasting your money in any guide...this is my way of traveling but if you like one they are easy to find... Still you Must come here

The Sultan Ahmet Mosque, which is popularly known as the Blue Mosque as well, is easily accessible by a short walk from the most touristic center in Istanbul. Really hard to miss as it can been seen from a far distance. Visitors are welcomed to walk around during daily opening hours. Interior visits are allowed in between religious services. An excellent location for memorable photos and one of the most impressive Turkish monuments. I would encourage visitors to hire a local guide for a short tour around the area and combine the visit to at least two or three locations. There are magnificent places to visit nearby and the price while small will add lots of value to the experience. A must see.

—>Fun fact: the lamps have hangers to put the ostrich eggs that were used during that period to ward off the spiders—which are protected in Islam because a story tells that they saved the life of the Prophet Muhammad.

Lovely  mosque completed around 1616. A must see place in İSTANBUL . You will see flocks of visitors. Local Guides are available. Please note there is repair work going on. Please check visiting days and times. There is clothing guide lines and need to remove shoes before your enter main praying hall of mosque.
A gem 💎 so tasty so cheap so friendly

Loved our stay here! The receptionist is friendly and helpful. Location is very near to blue mosque, hagia sophia, topkapi palace, basilica cistern, grand bazaar and spice bazaar. There’s BIM just 190 meter away. The breakfast was nice with great view overlooking the ocean.

The pictures from booking are not reflecting the reality. The bathroom and the room are very small. The kitchen is at last floor, not very organised.
Actualy, i think is in an old building, reconfigured to be a hotel.
Pro : The stuff was kind and very polite.
Great location, very close to main spots. Safe area. Room was comfortable and clean. Staff was very kind. I recommend this hotel!
Excellent service, staff  is provided personalize care about the guests.
A gem 💎 so tasty so cheap so friendly

Simple love this place. It’s not only close to all the correct places but provides exceptional service. It is definitely expensive but money is all worth it. I didn’t like their food in the restaurant So I cannot recommend that. But you don’t have to eat there:)) 
Having platinum cafe next to the hotel is so nice. They have good young crowd and decent food as well. It’s a shisha place for all non smokers!

The staff were attentive and gracious. We had a wonderful evening in the restraint and bar, moving seemed from out doors to India as the evening cooled down. The food was lovely.

Beautiful hotel in the middle of the old city. The location could not be better. Its right next to the Blue Mosque and walking distance from the Grand Bazaar. 

The rooms are luxurious and immaculate. They are very well decorated and spacious. 

The food at the restaurant is excellent and offers a large variety of local dishes. 

The garden in the middle of the hotel is neatly kept and it feels like an oasis. 

An interesting fact about the building is that it used to be a prison back in the day. 

The staff is very courteous and knowledgeable.  And everyone speaks english. 

I would definitely recommend this hotel. It is the best place to stay in the Sultanahmet area.

In simple terms the outdoor items are falling apart due weather wear and tear. The indoor exhibits are good and as you through the building you will be surprised the size and depth of the building. Not much in the English translation but planes tell a lot. For a museum the indoor exhibits are very good. But the outdoor looks like a scrap yard or dumping ground for old decommissioned equipment. Worth a look but do not expect miracles. For what you pay it is fair.

You can see here helicopters, fighter jets and old memorabilia connected to aviation history. There are 2 large hangars in which the exhibits are well kept, the stuff that is kept outside could use a new repainting. You can easily spend an hour or two here. Worth a visit if you can get there, it's a bit off the beaten track for tourists. This time off the year it's open from 9 to 15:30 with 14:30 last entry. Tickets cost 10 Ron for adults and  half for children, the soldier at the gate said my daughter could enter free of charge.

They have some very interesting aircraft, but they need to be restored and properly displayed. It seems to be like a communist era museum. Needs to be more interactive. Needs a coffee shop and a gift shop. Great potential for a very attractive museum but investment is needed.
It's beautiful and you can learn a lot about Romania's airplanes history.

Interesting Old museum with a range of old planes (MIG's) from WW2 (and not only) that needs a larger place for a proper exibition of those. We have a history also in aviation and we need to share this with the people. I just found out, visiting the museum, that we had women's in aviation and mens that were pioneers frying a certain type of plane. Why this is not shared in local news..?!? This museum is also not known to the public. It's not so great as the museums in other countries but he exists and needs investments to continue to exist. The planes from outside area are left to die, needs a little paint. They are lovely to see, and must confess that i didn't saw those in other museums from around the world. Some new helicopters outside that we see also at Bias. Worth to mention that some of the explanations are also in english. What is inside hangar  needs english translation, because the info is very interesting, explaining a day in live of an aviator. It will help if the museum would have some interactive parts..maybe leave the simulators to be touched and tried by the public. Also, not only the planes needs explanation, you can add other interesting facts, stories from the military and aviation personnel.
